immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Hands-on experience with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, ROVs, and submersibles in the US.  Emphasis on practical application and networking, informed by recent research.

Key Interests: Identifying and joining US-based groups and universities actively involved in underwater habitat design, ROV technology, submersible operation, and ocean engineering; attending relevant US-based meetups and scuba events; directly contacting universities with strong ocean engineering programs related to underwater volcanology and submersible technology; exploring opportunities for hands-on involvement with underwater robots and ROVs. Focus on immediate, practical engagement.

Immediate Priorities: Researching and applying to US universities offering hands-on ROV, submersible, and underwater habitat design experience; identifying and contacting US-based organizations focused on underwater volcano research and ROV/submersible technologies; attending relevant diving/scuba events and technical meetups; direct outreach to universities and organizations specializing in underwater robotics and ocean engineering.

Research Priorities: ROV and submersible applications in deep-sea volcanic environments; underwater habitat design and construction; practical submersible and ROV operation and maintenance; identifying and connecting with key personnel at US universities and organizations to secure hands-on opportunities in underwater robotics and volcanology research.  Immediate, practical application and skill acquisition are paramount.

Further Exploration: Locating and contacting US-based diving, technical, and academic event organizers; actively pursuing hands-on ROV and submersible experience through US university programs, organizational affiliations, and volunteer opportunities; expanding research into specific universities and their ocean engineering programs; prioritizing immediate, practical experience and collaborative opportunities in underwater volcano research, undersea habitation, and ROV/submersible technology.
